alert.note: Alert for Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mingo and southwestern Logan Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Red Jacket, or 9 miles east of Williamson, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Red Jacket, Hinch, Holden, Bruno, Chauncey, Varney, Sarah Ann, Meador, Pie and Switzer. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 19 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
